       </a>

Johnson launched his <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/wonk/wp/2014/01/08/everything-you-need-to-know-about-the-war-on-poverty/\"> War on Poverty</a> that created Medicare, Medicaid, food assistance programs, educational aid and housing assistance. The aim, Johnson said, was not only to relieve the symptom of poverty, but to cure it and, above all, to prevent it."},{"_id":"2LP5ZUW24NH67D6UIFRAPNYUTA","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919192,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"While those initiatives substantially reduced poverty, even the most ardent supporters of these programs agree today there is no single cure to poverty, and often not a consistent measurement of effectiveness."},{"_id":"62CXRYLBD5GDHAJQNIGPQPT7DE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919193,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The modern reality is that state and federal governments and anti-poverty nonprofits spend billions providing and documenting benefits paid out, but fall short of measuring success in permanently improving lives."},{"_id":"D6RI225YHRCH7HYZS34KHM3OQE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919194,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"What brings this to mind now is President Joe Bidens $1.9 trillion relief package, which is being touted as the largest anti-poverty program since the 1960s. The new package allocates billions to aid the lowest-income Americans, such as <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/07/us/politics/whats-in-the-stimulus-bill.html\">direct checks and child and other tax credits</a> to millions of Americans, many without jobs or who live below the poverty line or barely earn enough to support their family. As a crisis response, Bidens plan has utility. As a poverty cure, its lasting impact is debatable."},{"_id":"FYUGZMY4KVBXDHIBX46APGIMMQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919195,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"There is no doubt that these infusions of cash will have a significant impact on income at a time when families are struggling under the weight of the pandemic. But that isnt the same as reducing poverty, as many social services already know. Nonprofits and social service agencies that work with poor families and the homeless are looking away from infusions of dollars as a long-term solution and toward stressing accountability, measurable results and individualized strategies."},{"_id":"R7XA7TVIERETHASUQQHDUOWS6I","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919196,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"At the inception of the War on Poverty, the nations poverty rate was about 19%, and by the mid-1970s had fallen to about 11%. Since then, the poverty rate <a href=\"https://www.census.gov/library/publications/2020/demo/p60-270.html#:~:text=The%20official%20poverty%20rate%20in,and%20Table%20B%2D5).\">has fluctuated roughly between 9% to 15%</a> through recessions, troubled labor markets and bull markets, with the rate for Black and Hispanic Americans much higher than for non-Hispanic whites and Asian-Americans."},{"_id":"CPOY2DQ7YZEJTPBXLD64WJUGMU","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919197,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"After a year of COVID-related upheaval, <a href=\"https://www.urban.org/sites/default/files/publication/103656/2021-poverty-projections.pdf\">the Urban Institute projects </a>an overall 2021 poverty rate of 13.7%, meaning that about 1 in 7 Americans may have annual family resources below the poverty threshold. And the research group makes that projection based on an expanded poverty measure that considers not only a familys cash income but also their tax payments, tax credits, in-kind benefits such as nutrition help, and the stimulus checks now being delivered to Americans."},{"_id":"IWDDW6PMYJGVJPASTOLGFRNZXA","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919198,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"This suggests to us two points. The first is that historical, systemic and generational challenges impact different segments of society differently. The second is that tossing cash toward lifting people out of poverty isnt a panacea, either."},{"_id":"NTLYL7BWSZB2XGYTOQHTSQXG34","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919199,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[{"comment":"s","pos":274}]},"content":"Gaining currency in the social services sphere is the understanding that activity without measurable, evidence-based successes is a recipe for not using limited resources as effectively as possible. And that will be the litmus test for the overall effectiveness of the Biden relief package on changing the trajectory of poverty in America."},{"_id":"PAAACGG6UJDEZEHVJ54UFR3RIQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919200,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Traditionally, anti-poverty programs are caught between clashing political approaches. One, offered by progressives, tends to offer entitlement programs to provide aid quickly to those in need. The other centers more on empowerment, which focuses on ensuring that the government doesnt impose obstacles to Americans looking to improve their economic conditions. In truth, the question of whether a strategy actually reduced poverty is seldom asked, and, if asked, seldom answered."},{"_id":"QZVNGYCZGVDFLH4LCZZO7DYJBI","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919201,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The process begins with goal-setting and directly linking the avenues out of poverty to the needs of individuals beyond simply connecting recipients with federal benefits. In some cases, help on a job search is all that is needed. In other instances, support to return to a classroom for additional skills, or housing can determine whether someone rises out of poverty or not. Even the task of astutely matching community college students with mentors can be transformational."},{"_id":"VUHZRW375NDWLATVH7LRQERSGU","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919202,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Our point is that a single template has its limits and likely wont have the lasting impact that tracking clients, personalizing assistance and adjusting as those needs change will provide."},{"_id":"SFYXKQXWOJBZ5MGTNTOHWJ2AVU","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919203,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[{"comment":"leading that organization","pos":352}]},"content":"An example of this can be found in the partnership of Catholic Charities Fort Worth and the Wilson Sheehan Lab for Economic Opportunities (LEO) at the University of Notre Dame. It is led by Heather Reynolds, <a href=\"https://www.star-telegram.com/opinion/cynthia-m-allen/article209313799.html\">who is credited with effectively refocusing </a>Catholic Charities Fort Worth into a nationally respected anti-poverty agency during her long tenure. Together, LEO and Catholic Charities are working to quantify the impact evidence-based models have had in addressing and reducing poverty."},{"_id":"IX4FGUI7RVBSTCN3ECJUCSNXKQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919204,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"So how has it worked out? Catholic Charities Fort Worths goal is an individualized program called Padua, designed to teach people to problem-solve, a skill that helps them manage household budgets, save enough to withstand a minor financial setback, and generally break the destructive cycles and behaviors that keep them in poverty. After going through the program, for example, people previously not employed at the start of the program were 67% more likely to have obtained a full-time job and those without stable housing at the start of the program were 60% more likely to have stable housing."},{"_id":"MBCCKCQ7S5GRLIB2I23DNPCHLU","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919205,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Likewise, in Dallas, we are intrigued by Mandy Chapman Semple, who eight years ago in Houston, employed an information management system and targeted military veterans for expedited housing assistance. The city housed thousands of vets in three years, and attracted new partnerships to share data and resources needed to add transitional and permanent supportive housing with specialized services."},{"_id":"HUUMKNHIURBKZETKUVBMGZOP6Q","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919206,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Now shes advising Dallas to end homelessness among veterans by the end of this year; significantly reduce chronic unsheltered homelessness by 2023; and reduce family and youth homelessness by 2025."},{"_id":"Z4RDTLEVKBFBHKASN7N2RUBLOQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919207,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Myriad factors contribute to a person or family finding themselves in poverty or without stable housing, and the way out wont be the same for each person. But in our mind, individual successes add up to many successes and are possible only if strategic planning and impact analyses focus anti-poverty efforts to ensure we make lasting progress."},{"_id":"DD2CJFBRORDI7FRF72LO36IK5E","type":"raw_html","additional_properties":{"_id":"OCGTMKRGJRCKDCHU23TYZ2I6XQ","comments":[]},"content":"%3Ch3%3EThis%20editorial%20was%20written%20by%20the%20editorial%20board%20and%20serves%20as%20the%20voice%20and%20opinion%20of%20The%20Dallas%20Morning%20News.%3C%2Fh3%3E%0D%0A%3Cdiv%20style%3D%22padding%3A%2020px%200%3B%22%3E%0D%0A%3Ca%20href%3D%22https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dallasnews.com%2Foffers%2Fsign-up%3Fpage%3Deditorial%22%20target%3D%22_blank%22%3E%3Cimg%20src%3D%22https%3A%2F%2Finteractives.dallasnews.com%2Fimages%2Fcta.jpg%22%20alt%3D%22An%20image%20of%20the%20front%20of%20the%20Dallas%20News%20offices%20with%20the%20text%20'Local%20Journalism%20Matters.%20Subscribe%20today'%20laid%20over%20the%20top%20of%20it.%22%20%2F%3E%20%3C%2Fa%3E%0D%0A%3C%2Fdiv%3E%0D%0A"},{"_id":"Y6TJC3GQDJCGBGEX5Y6H5HAXTQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919209,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"<b>Got an opinion about this issue? Includes Dallas, Plano, Frisco, McKinney, Arlington, Irving and beyond.","path":"/news/politics","parent_id":"/news","parent":{"default":"/news"},"additional_properties":{"original":{"_id":"/news/politics","site":{"site_description":"Breaking news and investigations on politics and policy in Texas, from City Council to the State Legislature. Includes Dallas, Plano, Frisco, McKinney, Arlington, Irving and beyond.","site_title":"Politics | Dallas Morning News"},"_website":"dallas-news","name":"Politics","order":{"header":2016,"default":2002,"app":2002},"parent":{"default":"/news","header":"/news","app":"/news"},"ancestors":{"header":["/","/news"]},"inactive":false,"node_type":"section"}},"_website_section_id":"dallas-news./news/politics"},"website_url":"/news/politics/2021/03/20/botham-jean-boulevard-in-dallas-will-become-official-march-27/"}},"additional_properties":{"clipboard":{},"has_published_copy":true},"publish_date":"2021-03-20T01:48:26.280Z","publishing":{"scheduled_operations":{"publish_edition":[],"unpublish_edition":[]}},"website":"dallas-news","website_url":"/news/politics/2021/03/20/botham-jean-boulevard-in-dallas-will-become-official-march-27/"},{"_id":"RH5AUFG6EBFGLLAYFSQTX2JUFI","type":"story","version":"0.10.7","content_elements":[{"_id":"QE3LQSQ7MVC6VOSSE3VX5GK2DQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048824,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"<i>This op-ed is part of a series published by The Dallas Morning News Opinion section to explore ideas and policies for strengthening electric reliability. Find the full series here: </i><a href=\"https://www.dallasnews.com/opinion/commentary/2021/02/24/what-will-it-take-to-keep-the-lights-on-in-texas/\"><i>Keeping the Lights On</i></a><i>.</i>"},{"_id":"XIX76CB3VNBYRGT7I6TIWBNO6M","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048825,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Everyone in Texas who lived through the 2021 Valentines Day blizzard can by now identify the problems that led to the blackouts and frozen pipes. Identifying solutions that are practical and affordable isnt quite as easy, but it is necessary to prevent gridwide outages in the future."},{"_id":"GLPCTDK6EBDKXLFIZOOETQ23JA","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048826,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The Texas Legislature and numerous private organizations are feverishly considering all levels of ideas. As Texas Sen. Kelly Hancock, chairman of the Business and Commerce committee, put it: We must review all aspects of the issue and come up with a plan to establish stability and reliability in Texas energy markets, thus restoring the confidence of the Texas public."},{"_id":"RKFNIVIHKVAYDKURTEJOBS4PPM","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048827,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Some of the most popular ideas dont actually do much for reliability, while the basic work of better coordination and communication can go far. Its important for lawmakers to think through the costs and potential benefits of policy changes."},{"_id":"EZVAF6E3FBF2VE34LFKNFELSMU","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048828,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"One popular idea is to interconnect the intrastate grid operated by the Electric Reliability Council of Texas with other national grids. This idea is expensive and offers only modest improvements to reliability."},{"_id":"JPMTYGRY5JCEVDFF45I6RIIFJ4","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048829,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Tom Kuhn, president of Edison Electric Institute, said, Interconnecting Texas with the national grid would have helped, but exactly how much is hard to calculate."},{"_id":"KZ7INCUZSFBSTLCQD2HYXWJEIM","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048830,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Former Texas Gov. and U.S. Secretary of Energy Rick Perry said it could be looked at but is skeptical of its benefits."},{"_id":"SXDKK4XILBHSVDXTQHTGWUAPNY","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048831,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"I agree with Perry for two reasons. On the practical level, no adjacent grid has the surplus power reserves necessary to have covered the Texas electricity shortages that at their peak were over 24,000 megawatts. The large load centers outside of Texas are over 1,000 miles away, in Phoenix to the west, Atlanta to the east, and St. Louis and Kansas City to the north. Mexico has a much smaller grid."},{"_id":"CHL7KYMJIZGZ7PZM56LS7LEG4A","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048832,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Building the long distance, high-voltage transmission systems required to bring power from those centers to Texas would be extremely expensive and difficult, if not impossible, to permit. Keep in mind the need to import power over such lines would be very infrequent, possibly once or twice in a very hot summer and only once every five or 10 years in a freakishly cold winter."},{"_id":"MXZB4IAWLVBBZLLJ42SJ6KPQPE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048833,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The practical reason the rest of the nation operates their electrical grids across state lines is that, with the exception of Hawaii and Alaska, they mostly have to. Its not economical or in many cases even possible to generate power from energy sources in their own states. Texas is blessed to have large energy sources of both conventional and renewable types that are economically viable."},{"_id":"OGYM4MKWJZFRFATFY2TU7QJCOY","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048834,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Politically, the idea makes no sense. Currently, decisions and changes in the law governing Texas electrical systems are made in Austin, by legislators elected by Texans. The laws are implemented by the Texas Public Utility Commission, appointed by the governor. If ERCOT were connected to the national grid, legislative changes would be made by the Congress, with two Texas senators out of 100, and 36 Texas representatives out of 435 House members. Federal law is executed by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission."},{"_id":"4WDJUF6GZRAK5OHQKL2DJ5MABA","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048835,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"It is unlikely that federal regulators and the majority of U.S. senators and House members would put as high a priority on whats best for Texas as the Texas Legislature, Texas governor and Texas PUC do."},{"_id":"IIGNNNZ3VBGNZHDD3VJMELKQVE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048836,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Another broad policy option is to go back to a regulated electricity system. Texas had such a system until the late 1990s and early 2000s, when the Legislature deregulated power generation and retail electricity sales. Only power lines remain regulated. Under a fully regulated system, all sectors would be managed by the PUC, which would set customer rates."},{"_id":"PPLV2DD35VCS5DJ5ZKTTXZZWGA","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048837,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The advantage of such a system is that the costs of actions like winter weatherization, if mandated by Texas law and approved by the Texas PUC, can be capitalized and socialized among all customers. But in a deregulated market like Texas has, such costs cant be passed through to customers directly, at least not easily."},{"_id":"6G2H5AYSZVFDVISENYS74WAEUI","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048838,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Deregulated markets promote efficiency, lower costs and retail choice, sometimes at the expense of reliability. In states that still have regulated electricity markets, consumers may have more reliability in extreme weather conditions, but they have less or no choice in providers and retail costs tend to be higher."},{"_id":"CN2OCTPJ2RF47P2YRG6QOWFCXQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048839,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The average retail price in Texas for electricity, according to the most recent Energy Information Agency price reports (2019) was 8.6 cents per kilowatt hour, 18% below the national average of 10.5 cents per kwh, and far below high-cost states like Massachusetts (18.4 cents per kwh), California (16.9 cents per kwh) and New York (14.4 cents per kwh)."},{"_id":"S6ZRAP7ACFCXZF5USQ6JPEDKLI","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048840,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"There is some merit to re-regulation of the ERCOT system, but on balance my preference is to keep our deregulated system with reforms."},{"_id":"LYY73CMRRBBNZJ76XL7JBJCW4I","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615982764791,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"One area that has received no consideration is the fuel mix for Texas electricity generation. No Texas law or ERCOT guideline outlines how much power should come from various conventional fuels and renewables. Consequently, the choice of fuel for new power plants in Texas has primarily been driven by the cost of the fuel."},{"_id":"4MOHN4XVEJEAPHWYWFLVI3CB5I","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048842,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Twenty years ago, Texas electricity was generated predominantly by coal, which represented half of the generation mix, then natural gas with approximately one-third, and nuclear with around one-sixth."},{"_id":"FXI5JHHAMRBCNHWWDOZOGADSTI","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048843,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Last year, according to ERCOT, coal was down to 18%, natural gas was up to 46%, and nuclear at 11%. Wind represented 23% of generation, and solar claimed 2%."},{"_id":"ACGISZYOORGX7H65E77F3PBSTM","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048844,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"There is nothing magic about the causes for the change in fuel source for Texas electricity generation. It comes down to costs. The Obama administrations expensive environmental regulations raised the cost of coal. Concurrently, federal and state incentives for wind and solar, plus technology breakthroughs, lowered renewable costs. Natural gas costs also declined because technology improvements in hydraulic fracturing and horizontal drilling made huge volumes economically viable in Texas."},{"_id":"KS7J44CRQ5CKTAC6EMQU4EDRVA","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048845,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"In Texas deregulated free market system, the fuel sources with declining costs gained market share (gas, wind and solar), those with increased costs lost market share (coal), and those with constant costs(nuclear), maintained the same amount of generating capacity."},{"_id":"NKMR6JSPUJDPPETJV4LXPD2BWE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048846,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"All well and good, except for one major fact. Not all fuel sources are equally reliable or available all the time. As Bud Albright, chief executive of the U.S. Nuclear Industry Council puts it, intermittent fuels give you intermittent power. It is imperative to evaluate the reliability of existing and new power plants and set some minimum reliability standard for renewable sources."},{"_id":"PAST267MT5CL5FZS7THCRIEY34","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048847,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"This wont be easy. First, there has to be better coordination among the various state regulatory bodies. The Texas PUC regulates the electricity industry, while the Texas Railroad Commission regulates the oil and gas industry. These two agencies must form a formal, active joint working group that develops a comprehensive list of recommendations for improving the reliability of the power grid."},{"_id":"3NQD5TZQIZDZLKAXODH4CNGXAQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048848,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"One area that must be addressed is ensuring that critical natural gas infrastructure has electricity to continue operating in an emergency, and thus delivering natural gas to fuel power generators. The critical infrastructure list that the transmission and distribution utilities maintain needs constant updating. Very few oil and gas wells, processing plants, and pipelines were on the critical infrastructure list before the storm. One senior executive at a major Permian Basin producer told me that nearly all of the companys oil and gas wells, gathering systems and pipelines were cut off from electric power for four days."},{"_id":"TW774D3UDVHTVJCSMW4QAVYPOI","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048849,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Some natural gas-fired power plants broke down because of weatherization issues, but some simply lacked fuel. One key piece of equipment is natural gas compressors that pump the natural gas through the pipelines. These once ran mostly on natural gas but now run on electricity to reduce emissions. Pipeline operators should consider new dual-fuel technology that would allow compressors to switch fuel in an emergency."},{"_id":"S5HXTY3CZ5CUTH42YC72IVJQDI","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048850,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Many wind turbines froze during the storm, but wind generators are not always reliable in any weather, because the wind doesnt always blow. Lawmakers should consider whether some portion of wind turbines should be required to have back-up generation with reliable fuel sources or ice melting equipment."},{"_id":"X2Q5HQBOPRGNHFIL2UL55YALKM","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048851,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"One reliable source worth exploring is nuclear power. The U.S. hasnt built a new nuclear plant in decades, but the Nuclear Regulatory Commission last year licensed a new, modern modular reactor. The new reactor designs are smaller and less expensive to build and operate than traditional reactors. Nuclear is a reliable and emission-friendly fuel source, and Texas leaders should evaluate how to encourage construction of new units. Such evaluation must include input from the citizens of Texas."},{"_id":"GAIXYIBDO5ERTDDAE2AJR6NCTY","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048852,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[{"comment":"also","pos":128}]},"content":"Texas can be rightfully proud that it is on the forefront of the renewable revolution, but we must also take steps to ensure we  lead the nation in reliability."},{"_id":"OTFQNXPD7JG4DDOAAJYWOIPFGM","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048853,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[{"comment":"Rick","pos":306}]},"content":"It might make sense to require more onsite storage of conventional fuel in the event of a supply disruption. And longer term, more battery storage should be included in the electrical distribution system. Current battery technology doesnt give extended storage capacity (about four hours now is max), but  Perry said, in the next five years the cost of battery storage is going to come down dramatically and the capacity to store electricity for much longer periods of time is going to go up significantly."},{"_id":"35VGRWCM5BBUDPQDVA3CR6KYB4","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048854,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The 1,000-pound gorilla in the room is the issue of weatherization. Easy to require, but difficult to decide how much is enough and who should pay for it in a deregulated market. Texas House Speaker Dade Phelans idea to use the Texas Rainy Day fund is innovative and should be considered. Another approach could be rebates from various ad valorem taxes, business taxes and severance taxes."},{"_id":"DRUPNJDAQZFGZPGHD433CIS6TE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048855,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Not all the issues are that complex. ERCOT board members should be required to live in Texas. The public should be notified earlier about potential blackouts. Likewise, when retail electricity providers market super-low rates based on wholesale market prices, they should be required to emphatically warn potential customers of the risk of price spikes."},{"_id":"CML7C32IPZDHFLUY4XRKU5RBT4","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048856,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The 2011 winter storm that triggered rolling outages was a wake-up call, and Texas hit the snooze button. This time Texans are wide awake and want to get to work fixing our electrical generation and delivery systems. I have faith we will."},{"_id":"7CF3TQGIV5GZXFPBAGVASIQNJI","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048857,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"<i>Joe Barton, a former Republican member of Congress representing Arlington, is establishing a federal policy consulting business. News.</i>"},{"_id":"5CB42L7O2NAE7M6U2G34XSGL4I","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615844048858,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"<b>Got an opinion about this issue? </b><a In all likelihood, hes looking at a third consecutive losing season with the Rangers."},{"_id":"3PXJUWIWNFF4PCZQGDJEP3SX6A","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616347035455,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"It has all the outward markings of a tenuous situation."},{"_id":"ZPSQHTXO6FA6JILKPZVVG7H5K4","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616347035456,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Beneath the surface, though, it looks different. The season is about growth for the organization and for Woodward as a manager rather than about passing final  judgment on his tenure. President of Baseball Operations Jon Daniels, who hired Woodward, gave every indication the club will very likely at least pick up the option, if not negotiate an extension. So did the new general manager, Chris Young."},{"_id":"VR5BKNGIERAVBDNMYA4J75N3YE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616347035457,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"I dont think contract status necessarily speaks to how somebody is valued, Daniels said. We are all in on [Woodward] and big believers in what he brings as both a person and as a manager of this team. And thats probably as succinctly as I can say it. And you know, weve had some things going on, and we just havent sat down and addressed it with him yet, but we certainly will and I wouldnt read anything into it otherwise."},{"_id":"BOXWRIBJLJED5AGTRLMOSQOSUU","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616347035458,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Among those things: Overhauling the roster, navigating a pandemic, creating a long-term vision for the organization and, um, hiring a new general manager. So, yeah, theyve had some things."},{"_id":"ML6XA77M45H4VLWMETE3VLMPEQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616347035459,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"And speaking of the new GM, who once pitched for a club on which Woodward was a coach, Young had this to say:"},{"_id":"PYRPBMHLPJAS7KGIYVGW3OTNKE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616347035460,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"My opinion has not changed on his leadership qualities, his ability to connect with people, his positivity and his energy. Its in holding our players to the highest standards, to continue to push them to be the best they can be and get the most out of them."},{"_id":"A327WNIFUBFUPNG2UJMYKUUI6E","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616347035462,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Here is where the growth can occur. Over the past two years, the Rangers have been a team without an identity in more ways than one. Not just in a cultural sense, but in roster construction. There were a handful of long-tenured veterans, a few short-timers and a gaggle of young players. Daniels termed it inconsistency in the roster, for which he takes accountability."},{"_id":"WXTFSFFR3RBOHGHWXU3U7A2PLQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616347035463,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"A year ago, maybe the inconsistency showed more. There were veterans who didnt perform, a season going nowhere and the push to take a look at others. Nowhere was that more evident than in the middle of the diamond. Neither Elvis Andrus nor Rougned Odor performed. Both, however, stayed in the lineup, even as Woodward suggested he would look at other options. And even as management indicated it was ready to look at other options, too."},{"_id":"K6B77IXEGRAELEGG3CE7WGCH3Y","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616347035464,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Andrus played shortstop until he finally decided his pride wasnt worth the ongoing back pain. Odor came back from three weeks on the IL with an eye infection to start at second for 16 of the final 20 games despite a batting average that never topped .170 and OBP that never got to .220."},{"_id":"HMGGAUMLNBFVDOGE4ITDGZQUSM","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616347035465,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Woodward would look over his nightly lineup combinations, see few, if any options to produce runs and get tempted by Odors history and power potential. apology, the French fries at 20 Feet Seafood Joint in East Dallas were a previously frozen product. There is unbeatable, crispy magic that occurs when a bag of shipped-on-the-truck fries hits a seething cauldron of oil, and 20 Feet owner and chef Marc Cassel knew exactly how to harness their powers. Into the fryer went the spuds, tangles of fresh rosemary and thyme  sticks and leaves and all  and lobes of garlic. A shake of seasoning, then it was all dropped in a basket or nested around crunchy, juicy fried cod."},{"_id":"U6AJRHZJ3FAS7KKYB53DKEYBI4","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615919762529,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Its one of many things to miss from 20 Feet Seafood Joint, which is officially another <a href=\"https://www.dallasnews.com/food/restaurant-news/2021/03/17/1-year-later-did-covid-19-cause-as-many-restaurant-closures-in-north-texas-as-expected/\" target=_blank>casualty of the pandemics onslaught on local businesses</a>. When it closed in the midst of the city-wide lockdown in March 2020, nobody thought, especially Cassel, that the last meal had already been served at the White Rock-area spot. He never felt right about reopening for takeout only or limited capacity  the numbers didnt add up for fresh seafood  and his Paycheck Protection Program loan covered his employees through the year."},{"_id":"VW6FYT4RS5FAVBUY3KEB742MSE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1615919762530,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"After lease negotiations couldnt be resolved, Cassel says, he was forced to permanently shut the doors and will be vacating the Peavy Road location, where they opened in 2013, by the end of March. ","copyright":"The Dallas Morning News","created_date":"2021-03-11T22:18:50Z","credits":{"by":[{"name":"Tom Fox","type":"author"}]},"height":5532,"last_updated_date":"2021-03-19T15:06:19Z","licensable":false,"owner":{"id":"dmn"},"source":{"name":"Tom Fox","source_type":"staff","additional_properties":{"editor":"photo center"},"edit_url":"https://dmn.arcpublishing.com/photo/NM7YN2AHCBH27CPNXVGNWZSZIE","system":"photo center"},"taxonomy":{},"type":"image","url":"https://cloudfront-us-east-1.images.arcpublishing.com/dmn/NM7YN2AHCBH27CPNXVGNWZSZIE.jpg","version":"0.10.3","width":3535,"subtitle":""},{"_id":"TIUTWHG7OZE4PFSGWGR6MKIXME","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616160972642,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"For the mocktails, the goal at Wicked Bold is to offer a true cocktail experience for the sober or the sober-curious. The <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/06/15/style/sober-curious.html\" target=_blank>health-focused sober-curious movement</a> has been gaining steam in the U.S. the last several years, even amid a pandemic, and has sparked the creation of many <a href=\"https://www.smartbrief.com/original/2020/05/nonalcoholic-drink-trend-shows-no-sign-slowing-down\" target=_blank>non-alcoholic beverage companies</a> as well as sober bars, like <a href=\"http://thesansbar.com/\" target=_blank>Sans Bar in Austin</a>. Existing beverage companies have also been pivoting to meet demand, offering no-alcohol and <a href=\"https://www.foodbev.com/news/top-three-no-and-low-beverage-trends-for-2020/\" target=_blank>low-alcohol options</a>."},{"_id":"4FW6MIU3YJEPNE2AQ66NHQTPFE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616166339003,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"But good craft mocktails can still be hard to find when going out in North Texas. Their drinks feature distilled non-alcoholic spirits from Ritual and Seedlip and Fre non-alcoholic wine mixed with simple syrups and housemade tinctures. Menu options for now include the Cucumber Fizz (Ritual Gin, a juniper tincture, lime juice, herbal syrup, Spindrift sparkling water and a cucumber garnish); The New Fashiond (Ritual Whiskey, simple syrup, lemon juice and orange peel); a twist on a margarita (Ritual Tequila, grapefruit juice, simple syrup, lime juice, SoCo Ginger Beer and rim salt); plus a grapefruit mimosa and a dessert martini made with Kin Euphorics Dream Light, oat milk, almond butter, ashwagandha root, simple syrup and topped with cinnamon."},{"_id":"H6F5NTVEYFFW5LVUSAZ6UEDKX4","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616160972650,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"<i>Wicked Bold opens April 23 at 3343 Long Prairie Road, # 3347, Flower Mound. ","bio":"Mark Lamster is the architectural critic of the Dallas Morning News, a professor in the architecture school at the University of Texas at Arlington, and a Loeb Fellow at the Harvard Graduate School of Design. His acclaimed biography of the late architect Philip Johnson, The Man in the Glass House, was published in November 2018 by Little, Brown.","longBio":"Mark Lamster is the award-winning architectural critic of the Dallas Morning News, a professor in the architecture school at the University of Texas at Arlington, and a Loeb Fellow at the Harvard Graduate School of Design. His acclaimed biography of the late architect Philip Johnson, The Man in the Glass House, was published in November 2018 by Little, Brown.\n\nLamster has been recognized by the Associated Press and the Society for Features Journalism for his writing, celebrated for his beautiful mind by D Magazine, which has named him the best critic in Dallas three times, and lauded for his sharp analytical eye by the alt weekly Dallas Observer. He was the recipient of the David Dunnigan Media Award from the Greater Dallas Planning Council in 2014 and the Robert Decherd Award for Civic Journalism, the papers highest honor, from the Dallas Morning News in 2015. In 2019 he received the Flowers Award for media from the Texas Society of Architects.\n\nLamster has been a contributing editor to Architectural Review, Design Observer, and ID and writes often for Architect, Architectural Record, and Metropolis, among other design titles. His work has appeared frequently in national publications and magazines, including the New York Times, the Los Angeles Times, and the Wall Street Journal.\n\nHe is the author of several books, a contributor to many others, and for more than a decade served as a senior editor at the publishing house Princeton Architectural Press, where he developed a series of influential titles on architecture and graphic design. Before joining the press, he served as an editor for George Braziller, the distinguished independent publisher of literature and illustrated books.\n\nThe research materials for his book Spaldings World Tour have been acquired by the National Baseball Hall of Fame, and are accesable to the public there as the Mark Lamster Papers.\n\nLamster is a native of New York City and now lives with his family in Dallas. He holds degrees from Johns Hopkins (BA), and Tufts fatigue in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic is a worldwide phenomenon. Public debt has risen sharply, and in many countries, including the United States, public debt is expected to continue to rise more rapidly than gross domestic product (GDP). Because the U.S. responded to this centurys two huge economic shocks with big increases in public debt, it will emerge from the pandemic as one of the worlds most indebted nations."},{"_id":"FLXFWY67UVH3RPWHVQJKUDD5ZQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616082630169,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[{"comment":",","pos":510},{"comment":";","pos":536}]},"content":"With debt and debt growth at unsustainable levels before the pandemic, the U.S. has already suffered debt fatigue for 50 years. Under current law, even between recessions, it will get worse. We need fiscal policy reform, including well-designed fiscal rules, to end our unsustainable debt growth. Without that reform, well do much more than hand a big tab to future generations of Americans. The current population will bear the burden of debt fatigue in the form of higher taxes, the hidden cost of inflation or higher borrowing costs  likely all three."},{"_id":"TEQ5I3AYIVDENFO2V5Y5LGTY34","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616082630170,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"As we make clear in our <a href=\"https://www.cato.org/books/fiscal-cliff\">new book</a>, were on a fiscal cliff because legislators across the globe responded to economic shocks with massive fiscal stimulus policies. That caused central banks, worldwide, to follow the lead of the U.S. Federal Reserve in pursuing unconventional monetary policies such as near-zero interest rates and debt finance by printing money."},{"_id":"T5KKFG6YXFHUXIPFR4VNUKCWJA","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616082630171,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[{"comment":",","pos":343}]},"content":"Though general inflation has not yet emerged, higher asset prices have been a key side effect of policies designed to shore up the financial system and stabilize economies. Irrational exuberance and appetite for risk are evident across a wide range of asset classes. The potentially speculative bubbles include stocks, real estate, commodities and esoteric assets such as bitcoin. Investors have poured unprecedented amounts of money into mutual and exchange traded funds that track global stocks. Stock values in Europe and Asia, as well as the U.S., have hit all-time highs. Even in Japan, where stocks have been depressed for decades, the Nikkei index rose above 3,000 for the first time in 30 years."},{"_id":"WGZMGIPQCVH47NJT6XW534HDLM","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616082630172,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Despite the massive stimulus programs launched in the U.S. in response to the financial crisis and the coronavirus pandemic, the U.S. continues to see reduced economic growth, and inflation far below the target levels of our central bank, the Fed. Despite a new policy framework that allows the Fed to provide substantial monetary stimulus, it has been unable to achieve target levels for inflation and unemployment. Analysts expect the post-stimulus U.S. economy to continue to see slower productivity change and economic growth in the long term."},{"_id":"NB2MA5AMCFCWRNK5HQ2XQD34XI","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616082630173,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The underperformance of the U.S. economy appears increasingly like Japans last three decades in which Japan saw a significant economic growth slowdown. Japans government incurred large deficits over that long period, leaving it with the worlds highest debt levels. The Bank of Japan pursued unconventional monetary policies, purchasing massive quantities of public and private bonds, and pushing inflation-adjusted interest rates well below zero. But those policies failed to jumpstart the Japanese economy, and the Bank of Japan appears to have hit a wall in what seems possible with their unconventional monetary policy."},{"_id":"W6FQBIKKEZF3DF4ASGT2MUR3OM","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616082630174,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The U.S. is not unique in catching the Japan disease. It is also become evident in Europe and other developed countries. Those countries experienced deflationary pressures, including low interest rates and zombie lending. Zombie lending is the extension of cheap credit to weak firms by weakly capitalized banks. Zombification results when non-viable firms stay afloat, and thus cling to resources better utilized elsewhere in the economy."},{"_id":"WHKGHOA74NHPPM3SZYIZSGYNDA","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616082630175,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Some of the substantial controversy regarding zombification of the U.S. economy may be the result of confusing zombification and secular stagnation. The term secular stagnation refers to the school of thought that private markets cannot sustain economic activity at the full employment level. Those economic disciples of John Maynard Keynes argue that only countercyclical fiscal and monetary stimulus can sustain full employment. In contrast, much of the recent literature on the Japan disease and zombification argues that the huge expansionary fiscal and monetary responses to the 21st century economic shocks is the source of the widespread productivity change and economic growth slowdowns. In other words, the now rapidly spreading Japan disease  and the increasing zombification of the U.S. economy  is a result of failed macroeconomic policies, not private market failure. The remedy, we fear, as in Japan, will be hard to come by."},{"_id":"53YIYFRJJVGL7G2PGW7437XDWA","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616082630176,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"<i>John D. I checked into a hotel on my first trip to Myanmar/Burma, in 2004, the clerk asked for my preferred tee time. Thinking that in this former British colony she meant afternoon tea, I said, Three oclock?"},{"_id":"JVDWI7JSQ5D4DADKDJ6BXRNU2Q","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616341287458,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Only mornings, she said. Youre on the golf package. But I dont play golf, I said. Youre on the golf package, she repeated, adding that there would be no phone or internet service in that district of Yangon for the duration of my stay. Why not? I asked. Always repairs, she said."},{"_id":"WJM2MELKJ5AQBMW2TH63666JYE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616085594627,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"This was an inauspicious start to my cultural diplomacy mission, which was designed to meet poets and writers who might wish to participate in the University of Iowas world-renowned International Writing Program (IWP). What struck me in my literary encounters was the courage on display in spite of the ruthless oppression of the regime. Fearing student protests, the military rulers, the Tatmadaw, had closed the universities for all but two days of the year  commencement and graduation  and professors were ordered to sweep walkways and take turns on guard duty."},{"_id":"HCPRD7XTF5A4PCNAHILRQJPUEU","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616341287460,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"One writer, who had spent six years in solitary confinement for her ties to the Nobel Peace Prize Laureate Aung San Suu Kyi, said that in prison she and other writers referred to books as vitamins. Another novelist scanned used books for sale on the sidewalk for copies of her latest book, the reprinting of which had been forbidden by the authorities. Everybody spoke in whispers."},{"_id":"LZEPN6QEKJB7HIFCAH77H5A4AE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616085594628,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"But change was in the air when in January 2013 I brought a literary delegation to Yangon. International pressure and skillful American diplomacy had led the Tatmadaw to release Aung San Suu Kyi from house arrest in 2010, and when she was appointed State Counsellor in 2012, she and the National League for Democracy (NLD) began to institute reforms to bolster civil society."},{"_id":"Q3YEGYENP5DEZIQ7IGIEHBG35I","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616341287462,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"We were greeted at the reopened universities with much fanfare, visited new art galleries, and learned about new books writers were publishing. For sale on the streets were T-shirts featuring a photograph of President Barack Obama and Suu Kyi, with OBURMA emblazoned at the top. Everyone in my delegation bought some to bring back to their families."},{"_id":"JLCJWMXCLZBZHDS3VXR2HMSRBY","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616085594629,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Suu Kyis luster began to fade when she refused to condemn the military crackdown on the Rohingya Muslims and refugees, which led to calls for her Nobel to be revoked. Then came the Tatmadaws <a href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-55882489\">coup dtat</a> on Feb. 1. When Suu Kyi and her Cabinet were deposed and placed under house arrest, people took to the streets in protest, banging pots and pans. The Tatmadaw responded with increasingly lethal force; more than 2,000 people have been detained, including nine poets, one of whom, IWP alumnus Maung Yu Py (see poem below), is said to have been severely beaten; he faces a two-year prison sentence when his case is brought to court on March 23, though his poet-lawyer, Nayi, has also been arrested. Two poets, K Zar Win and Myint Myint Zin, were killed on March 3, part of nearly 200 deaths thus far."},{"_id":"GEJM6LLHWBAHVJLG7LHJVFAVTQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616085594630,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"They have come for the poets, one observer quipped."},{"_id":"DUG2KT5UFVD6RBTSDETOFOC3HQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616085594631,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"One poet told me the Tatmadaw had tied Suu Kyis hands from the beginning of her rise to power, destroying any hope of a national reconciliation process  which is why she thinks civil war is looming. Another Burma watcher believes the Tatmadaw have miscalculated, arguing that their use of water cannons, stun guns, rubber bullets and snipers with live ammunition will only backfire, bringing yet more protesters into the streets. Of Maung Yu Pys court case, a poet said, If we win, hell be out. If not, well be in."},{"_id":"JSPZYVRO4NCENAG4N6LUUYX5T4","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616085594632,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Their fate may depend on what steps are taken by the Biden administration to restore some semblance of democracy. Merrill","org":"","type":"author"}]},"subtype":"","first_publish_date":"2021-03-21T06:30:00.547Z","websites":{"dallas-news":{"website_section":{"_id":"/opinion/commentary","_website":"dallas-news","type":"section","version":"0.6.0","name":"Commentary","description":"Op-eds from outside contributors to The Dallas Morning News Opinion section.","path":"/opinion/commentary","parent_id":"/opinion","parent":{"default":"/opinion"},"additional_properties":{"original":{"_id":"/opinion/commentary","site":{"site_description":"Op-eds from outside contributors to The Dallas Morning News Opinion section.","site_title":"Commentary | Dallas Morning News"},"_website":"dallas-news","name":"Commentary","order":{"header":2002,"default":2002,"app":2002},"parent":{"default":"/opinion","header":"/opinion","app":"/opinion"},"ancestors":{"header":["/","/opinion"]},"inactive":false,"node_type":"section"}},"_website_section_id":"dallas-news./opinion/commentary"},"website_url":"/opinion/commentary/2021/03/21/in-burma-they-have-come-for-the-poets/"}},"additional_properties":{"clipboard":{},"has_published_copy":true},"publish_date":"2021-03-21T15:57:02.222Z","publishing":{"scheduled_operations":{"publish_edition":[],"unpublish_edition":[]}},"_id":"M32IY27ZIVEQDECJTNXO3KAMQY","website":"dallas-news","website_url":"/opinion/commentary/2021/03/21/in-burma-they-have-come-for-the-poets/"},{"type":"story","version":"0.10.7","content_elements":[{"_id":"WW22TGINGZBNFKUKEG4T3ZWYUI","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919191,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"In the 1960s, President Lyndon B. Johnson launched his <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/wonk/wp/2014/01/08/everything-you-need-to-know-about-the-war-on-poverty/\"> War on Poverty</a> that created Medicare, Medicaid, food assistance programs, educational aid and housing assistance. The aim, Johnson said, was not only to relieve the symptom of poverty, but to cure it and, above all, to prevent it."},{"_id":"2LP5ZUW24NH67D6UIFRAPNYUTA","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919192,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"While those initiatives substantially reduced poverty, even the most ardent supporters of these programs agree today there is no single cure to poverty, and often not a consistent measurement of effectiveness."},{"_id":"62CXRYLBD5GDHAJQNIGPQPT7DE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919193,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The modern reality is that state and federal governments and anti-poverty nonprofits spend billions providing and documenting benefits paid out, but fall short of measuring success in permanently improving lives."},{"_id":"D6RI225YHRCH7HYZS34KHM3OQE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919194,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"What brings this to mind now is President Joe Bidens $1.9 trillion relief package, which is being touted as the largest anti-poverty program since the 1960s. The new package allocates billions to aid the lowest-income Americans, such as <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/07/us/politics/whats-in-the-stimulus-bill.html\">direct checks and child and other tax credits</a> to millions of Americans, many without jobs or who live below the poverty line or barely earn enough to support their family. As a crisis response, Bidens plan has utility. As a poverty cure, its lasting impact is debatable."},{"_id":"FYUGZMY4KVBXDHIBX46APGIMMQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919195,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"There is no doubt that these infusions of cash will have a significant impact on income at a time when families are struggling under the weight of the pandemic. But that isnt the same as reducing poverty, as many social services already know. Nonprofits and social service agencies that work with poor families and the homeless are looking away from infusions of dollars as a long-term solution and toward stressing accountability, measurable results and individualized strategies."},{"_id":"R7XA7TVIERETHASUQQHDUOWS6I","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919196,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"At the inception of the War on Poverty, the nations poverty rate was about 19%, and by the mid-1970s had fallen to about 11%. Since then, the poverty rate <a href=\"https://www.census.gov/library/publications/2020/demo/p60-270.html#:~:text=The%20official%20poverty%20rate%20in,and%20Table%20B%2D5).\">has fluctuated roughly between 9% to 15%</a> through recessions, troubled labor markets and bull markets, with the rate for Black and Hispanic Americans much higher than for non-Hispanic whites and Asian-Americans."},{"_id":"CPOY2DQ7YZEJTPBXLD64WJUGMU","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919197,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"After a year of COVID-related upheaval, <a href=\"https://www.urban.org/sites/default/files/publication/103656/2021-poverty-projections.pdf\">the Urban Institute projects </a>an overall 2021 poverty rate of 13.7%, meaning that about 1 in 7 Americans may have annual family resources below the poverty threshold. And the research group makes that projection based on an expanded poverty measure that considers not only a familys cash income but also their tax payments, tax credits, in-kind benefits such as nutrition help, and the stimulus checks now being delivered to Americans."},{"_id":"IWDDW6PMYJGVJPASTOLGFRNZXA","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919198,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"This suggests to us two points. The first is that historical, systemic and generational challenges impact different segments of society differently. The second is that tossing cash toward lifting people out of poverty isnt a panacea, either."},{"_id":"NTLYL7BWSZB2XGYTOQHTSQXG34","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919199,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[{"comment":"s","pos":274}]},"content":"Gaining currency in the social services sphere is the understanding that activity without measurable, evidence-based successes is a recipe for not using limited resources as effectively as possible. And that will be the litmus test for the overall effectiveness of the Biden relief package on changing the trajectory of poverty in America."},{"_id":"PAAACGG6UJDEZEHVJ54UFR3RIQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919200,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Traditionally, anti-poverty programs are caught between clashing political approaches. One, offered by progressives, tends to offer entitlement programs to provide aid quickly to those in need. The other centers more on empowerment, which focuses on ensuring that the government doesnt impose obstacles to Americans looking to improve their economic conditions. In truth, the question of whether a strategy actually reduced poverty is seldom asked, and, if asked, seldom answered."},{"_id":"QZVNGYCZGVDFLH4LCZZO7DYJBI","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919201,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The process begins with goal-setting and directly linking the avenues out of poverty to the needs of individuals beyond simply connecting recipients with federal benefits. In some cases, help on a job search is all that is needed. In other instances, support to return to a classroom for additional skills, or housing can determine whether someone rises out of poverty or not. Even the task of astutely matching community college students with mentors can be transformational."},{"_id":"VUHZRW375NDWLATVH7LRQERSGU","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919202,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Our point is that a single template has its limits and likely wont have the lasting impact that tracking clients, personalizing assistance and adjusting as those needs change will provide."},{"_id":"SFYXKQXWOJBZ5MGTNTOHWJ2AVU","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919203,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[{"comment":"leading that organization","pos":352}]},"content":"An example of this can be found in the partnership of Catholic Charities Fort Worth and the Wilson Sheehan Lab for Economic Opportunities (LEO) at the University of Notre Dame. It is led by Heather Reynolds, <a href=\"https://www.star-telegram.com/opinion/cynthia-m-allen/article209313799.html\">who is credited with effectively refocusing </a>Catholic Charities Fort Worth into a nationally respected anti-poverty agency during her long tenure. Together, LEO and Catholic Charities are working to quantify the impact evidence-based models have had in addressing and reducing poverty."},{"_id":"IX4FGUI7RVBSTCN3ECJUCSNXKQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919204,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"So how has it worked out? Catholic Charities Fort Worths goal is an individualized program called Padua, designed to teach people to problem-solve, a skill that helps them manage household budgets, save enough to withstand a minor financial setback, and generally break the destructive cycles and behaviors that keep them in poverty. After going through the program, for example, people previously not employed at the start of the program were 67% more likely to have obtained a full-time job and those without stable housing at the start of the program were 60% more likely to have stable housing."},{"_id":"MBCCKCQ7S5GRLIB2I23DNPCHLU","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919205,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Likewise, in Dallas, we are intrigued by Mandy Chapman Semple, who eight years ago in Houston, employed an information management system and targeted military veterans for expedited housing assistance. The city housed thousands of vets in three years, and attracted new partnerships to share data and resources needed to add transitional and permanent supportive housing with specialized services."},{"_id":"HUUMKNHIURBKZETKUVBMGZOP6Q","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919206,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Now shes advising Dallas to end homelessness among veterans by the end of this year; significantly reduce chronic unsheltered homelessness by 2023; and reduce family and youth homelessness by 2025."},{"_id":"Z4RDTLEVKBFBHKASN7N2RUBLOQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919207,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Myriad factors contribute to a person or family finding themselves in poverty or without stable housing, and the way out wont be the same for each person. But in our mind, individual successes add up to many successes and are possible only if strategic planning and impact analyses focus anti-poverty efforts to ensure we make lasting progress."},{"_id":"DD2CJFBRORDI7FRF72LO36IK5E","type":"raw_html","additional_properties":{"_id":"OCGTMKRGJRCKDCHU23TYZ2I6XQ","comments":[]},"content":"%3Ch3%3EThis%20editorial%20was%20written%20by%20the%20editorial%20board%20and%20serves%20as%20the%20voice%20and%20opinion%20of%20The%20Dallas%20Morning%20News.%3C%2Fh3%3E%0D%0A%3Cdiv%20style%3D%22padding%3A%2020px%200%3B%22%3E%0D%0A%3Ca%20href%3D%22https%3A%2F%2Fwww.dallasnews.com%2Foffers%2Fsign-up%3Fpage%3Deditorial%22%20target%3D%22_blank%22%3E%3Cimg%20src%3D%22https%3A%2F%2Finteractives.dallasnews.com%2Fimages%2Fcta.jpg%22%20alt%3D%22An%20image%20of%20the%20front%20of%20the%20Dallas%20News%20offices%20with%20the%20text%20'Local%20Journalism%20Matters.%20Subscribe%20today'%20laid%20over%20the%20top%20of%20it.%22%20%2F%3E%20%3C%2Fa%3E%0D%0A%3C%2Fdiv%3E%0D%0A"},{"_id":"Y6TJC3GQDJCGBGEX5Y6H5HAXTQ","type":"text","additional_properties":{"_id":1616179919209,"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"<b>Got an opinion about this issue?
